content: using the long tail cast-on join for knitting in taking your third needle in your right hand insert the third needle into the round while being careful not to twist any stitches place a marker for the first loop on both needles in your left hand knit these two loops the bor together repeat this step once more knit all stitches for 10 rounds taking one of the needles in your left hand slide the right stitch on the right needle over the left this stitch is now bound off © anne hids 2023 v1 #arcoprojectbag * knit the first stitch of both needles in your left hand together bind off crochet drawstring one stitch on your right needle* repeat ** until there are no more using a 3 5 mm crochet hook ch2 single_crochet single_crochet in second chain stitches on the left needles cut the yarn and pull through the last stitch from the hook turn the work and single_crochet into the two loops indicated in the picture below repeat until the string has the desired length weave in all ends block the bag weave in the ends drawstrings there are multiple options for making a drawstring using a ready-made ribbon crocheting or knitting one in all cases you need two drawstrings each measuring 60 70 80 cm when the drawstrings are finished use a safety pin to pull them through the casing as follows attach a large safety pin to one end of one of the drawstrings at one side of the bag put the drawstring through the left hole red circle push the drawstring through the casing until you reach the right hole black circle and pull it through knot the ends together repeat on the other side of the bag knitted drawstring for a knitted drawstring we knit a 3-stitch i-cord using the 3 mm double pointed needles using the long-tail cast on cast on 3 st 1 slide the stitches to the other end of the needle 2 knit the 3 st repeat step 1 & 2 until you reach the desired length © anne hids 2023 v1 #arcoprojectbag weave in the ends lining from your cotton fabric cut two pieces measuring 22 x 20 27 x 25 32 x 30 cm lay these rectangles on top of each other with the right sides of the fabrics facing each other now sew the two short sides and one long side together with a 1 cm seam allowance trim half a cm of each of the sewn sides using an iron fold over the top 1 cm of the unsewn side to the wrong side of the fabric place the lining into the knitted bag and sew the lining into the bag by hand on the seam of the folded edge you knit enjoy your new project bag © anne hids 2023 v1
